creator: woolfel@yahoo.com
text:
This bug is related to another soap bug already reported
http://nagoya.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=8961.  I'm trying to use
JMeter to test a ASPX web service. What happens is the server responds "Server
found content type to be 'application/x-www-form-urlencoded', but expected
'text/xml'". The request has to be sent with text/xml encoding since that's what
ASPX webservice demands. I did a little testing with JWSDP and javax.xml.soap
works fine with IIS. the better way to handle webservice soap requests would be
to load the parameters from the WSDL. I'm still trying to find a simple solution
to this that doesn't requiring writing a whole new HTTP sampler and all the
necessary gui elements. Additional information. I use HTTP Header Manager to add
"Content-type: text/xml" and "SOAPAction: <the-url>".

peter lin

I've written a new sampler that implements the sample interface and a gui class
for it. Now I need to add it to the list of samplers, any one care to provide a
tip on this. Once I am done, I will submit the code for acceptance. Since the
base class HttpSampler uses URLConnection, there isn't an easy way to use
javax.xml.soap with it. Therefore it's cleaner to have a new sampler that uses
JWSDP soap drivers.
creator: woolfel@yahoo.com
woolfel@yahoo.com

I wrote a basic webservice sampler using apache soap driver. I've tested it with
IIS webservice and it works. more testing is needed to make sure it works with
other webservice engines.

creator: woolfel@yahoo.com

text: I updated the component_reference.xml file with an entry for the webservice sampler.
creator: woolfel@yahoo.com
woolfel@yahoo.com
text:
I'm working on simple support for WSDL, but not sure what the policy is on GUI 
components triggering pop up dialogs or wizards. I looked real briefly on the 
documentation and didn't see any specific guidelines addressing it. anyone know 
the answer to that?

creator: mstover1@apache.org
text:
It's acceptable to pop-up any dialogs or wizards you like.  In fact, we're
planning on doing something similar with the listeners to let users pop-up a
wizard that lets them configure logging more closely.  So, feel free.

Made a few changes/additions, such as adding a field to allow users to enter a
filename that holds the xml data (rather than using the text field).  The text
field is still there, but the filefield will override it if set.

Please test my changes since I can't - I hope I didn't break anything.
creator: mstover1@apache.org

creator: woolfel@yahoo.com
text:
I figured out my weird ConnectionException. It was caused by calling my 
WSDLException with an exception in the constructor. On one system I had 
System.out.println(exc.getMessage()) and on another system I didn't. I forgot 
to double check the exception class to make sure it was the same. Once I looked 
at the file, it was like DUH! stupid.

Created attachment 6925
patch for exception class

text:
Just attached a bunch of clean up of the classes. I removed printout statements 
and other garbage. I also added the apache license to the source files. A new 
create a webservice test plan doc was written for the sampler.
I've tested the code the last two weeks and it seems pretty solid.

creator: mstover1@apache.org
text:
Well, I've done the best I could.  I couldn't do everything without making patch
files, and I don't have time for that.  I think we just need to get you guys
committer status.
